website_summaries.verdict: These bike gloves are great for summer, with their fingerless design and moisture-wicking fabric.
pros: Wide opening with simple hook-and-loop closure
Comes in a variety of colors and sizes
cons: Run small – consider sizing up when ordering

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, lazy construction (uncomfortable)
customer_reviews.text: Gloves fit perfect. However, within 2 minutes, kid began complaining that they caused itching. I then discovered that the seams, while beautiful from the outside, were horrible on the inside! They had been sewn with way too much extra material that caused discomfort. I don’t get why companies don’t seem to put much care into kid’s products, especially something like this! When you make a product that is supposed to improve comfort and protection for a sport, but it increases discomfort, how does that help the kid enjoy the sport?
customer_reviews.author: Buckaroo

customer_reviews.title: My 6 year old uses these on the playground for ...

customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Good quality protection for little hands.
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by these gloves, given the super-cheap price. They fit well, they are made well, and they have enough material to prevent children from getting the dreaded road-rash palm when the kids catch themselves on their palms after falling off their bikes. They aren't "true" cycling gloves in terms of having gel padding (there's no padding at all) but there is good, reasonably thick faux leather on the palm that has survived several spills for us without tearing or wearing out. We bought three pairs, and the quality is consistent.

Just search for Monkey Bar Gloves. The ones for ages 5-6 fit Home perfectly and they are great! Expensive, but work well.
